intro: Arthromeris himalovata, commonly known as the Himalayan arthromeris, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes caraway and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine environments, thriving at high altitudes. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which are typical of the Apiaceae family. Its leaves are usually finely divided and have a strong, spicy scent.
